subCategories.name: Unsafe equipment
subCategories.description: Poorly maintained or outdated equipment can pose safety risks. It's essential to regularly inspect and maintain playground structures to address any potential hazards.

subCategories.name: Tripping hazards
subCategories.description: Uneven surfaces, protruding objects, or loose materials can cause children to trip and fall. Ensuring a smooth and even surface is important.

subCategories.name: Broken Equipment
subCategories.description: Playground equipment that is damaged or broken can be dangerous. Regular maintenance and prompt repairs are necessary to address any issues promptly.

subCategories.name: Litter and Debris
subCategories.description: Accumulation of litter or debris can create an unsafe environment. Regular cleaning and maintenance are essential to keep the playground area clean and safe.

subCategories.name: Lack of Inclusive Design
subCategories.description: Playgrounds should be designed to be inclusive for children with disabilities. Lack of accessibility features can exclude some children from enjoying the play area.

subCategories.name: Limited Signage
subCategories.description: Clear signage, including safety guidelines and age-appropriate recommendations, can help parents and caregivers ensure their children are using the equipment correctly.

subCategories.name: Unsafe Surroundings
subCategories.description: The playground's surroundings, such as proximity to busy roads or lack of fencing, can pose security risks. A secure perimeter and appropriate fencing can help keep children safe.

subCategories.name: Vandalism and Crime
subCategories.description: Instances of vandalism or criminal activity can affect the safety and cleanliness of the playground. Adequate lighting and community involvement can help deter such activities.

subCategories.name: Poor Hygiene
subCategories.description: Lack of hygiene facilities or poor upkeep of restroom facilities can be a concern for parents and caregivers. Maintaining cleanliness in and around the playground is crucial for public health.

Overcrowding.name: Limited Space
Overcrowding.description: Insufficient space and overcrowding can lead to conflicts among children or accidents. Proper planning and design can help prevent overcrowding issues.
